intro: Silene patula var. hesperia, commonly known as the Hesperian catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, pink to white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has hairy, narrow leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open habitats such as dry meadows and coastal areas. Silene patula var. hesperia is an important component of local ecosystems, supporting various pollinators and wildlife.
